'''Doduo''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ドードー''' ''Dodo'') is a dual-type {{2t|Normal|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Dodrio}} starting at [[level]] 31.

==Biology==
Doduo is a two-headed, bipedal avian Pokémon. Each head has a long sharp beak and two beady black eyes with no discernible sclerae. It has a soft but bristly, {{wp|Down feather|down-like}} covering of brown feathers on its body and both heads. The males of the species have black flexible necks, whereas females have brown necks; both genders have brown coloring on their legs. It has two feet, each with four digits ending in a sharp claw.

Even when sleeping or nourishing itself with food and water, one head is always awake and alert and keeps a keen eye out for enemies. Both heads have an identical brain. However, it is believed that on occasion they may possess different sets of brains. It is also theorized that the two heads communicate with some form of telepathy to be coordinated with one another. Due to its almost non-existent wings, it cannot fly very well but has developed its legs to be a very powerful runner. Reaching speeds of 60&nbsp;mph (96.5&nbsp;km/h), it energetically strides across the plains leaving large, 4" (10.6&nbsp;cm) deep foot prints behind it. Doduo lives in wide open {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|plains, grasslands, and savannahs.}}

==In the anime==
[[File:Doduo anime.png|200px|thumb|left|Doduo in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Doduo debuted in a cameo at {{an|Professor Oak}}'s laboratory in ''[[EP065|Showdown at the Po-ké Corral]]'', under the ownership of [[Gary Oak]]. It eventually evolved into a {{p|Dodrio}}.

In ''[[EP073|Bad to the Bone]]'', [[Otoshi]] tried to fight off {{TRT}} with a Doduo, but he was failing miserably until his {{p|Marowak}} decided to return.

===Minor appearances===
A Doduo appeared in ''[[EP069|Lights, Camera, Quack-tion]]'', as part of the cast for the movie "{{DL|Movies in the Pokémon world|Pokémon in Love}}".

Doduo also appeared in ''[[M02|The Power of One]]''.

A Doduo was one of the Pokémon seen at the Pokémon Swap Meet in ''[[EP146|Tricks of the Trade]]''.

A Doduo was one of the Pokémon seen at [[Wings Alexander]]'s barn in ''[[EP223|Throwing in the Noctowl]]''.

Multiple Doduo appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]''.

A Doduo was seen in the greenhouse in ''[[AG147|Sweet Baby James]]'', where it was being looked after by [[Nanny and Pop-Pop]].

A Doduo appeared in ''[[DP033|All Dressed Up With Somewhere To Go!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Pokémon Dress-Up Contest]].

A Doduo appeared in ''[[DP071|Pokémon Ranger and the Kidnapped Riolu! Part One]]''.

A Doduo made a brief appearance under the ownership of a Trainer in the [[Lily of the Valley Conference]] in ''[[DP182|An Old Family Blend!]]''.

A Doduo appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

A Doduo appeared in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]'', and again during a flashback in ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]''.

A Doduo appeared in ''[[XY009|Clemont's Got a Secret!]]''.

A Doduo appeared in ''[[XY018|Awakening the Sleeping Giant]]''.

A Doduo appeared in [[SS028]].

A Doduo appeared in ''[[SS031|Mega Evolution Special II]]''.

Two Doduo appeared in ''[[XY053|A Race for Home!]]''.

Mutltiple Doduo appeared in ''[[SS032|Mega Evolution Special III]]'', including some belonging to {{pkmn|Trainer}}s.

A Trainer's Doduo appeared in ''[[XY136|Forming a More Perfect Union!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Yellow Dody Doduo.png|thumb|200px|Doduo in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
[[File:Mr Fuji Doduo Egg.png|thumb|left|150px|A Doduo hatching from its {{pkmn|Egg}} in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Dody}}
In ''[[PS013|Sigh for Psyduck]]'', [[Mr. Fuji]] is revealed to have had a Doduo that passed away due to old age, but could not be properly buried due to the {{p|Gastly|unidentified ghost}} that haunted the [[Pokémon Tower]]. After {{adv|Red}} and {{adv|Blue}} succeed in defeating it and [[Koga]], it was finally able to rest in peace.

A Doduo appeared as a silhouette when {{adv|Green}} explains about {{p|Mew}} in ''[[PS017|The Jynx Jinx]]''.

Prior to her appearance in ''[[PS042|Do do that Doduo]]'', {{adv|Yellow}} was given a [[Yellow (Adventures)#Dody|Doduo]] that eventually evolved in ''[[PS089|The Might of... Metapod?!]]''. The person who gave her Doduo is revealed in ''[[PS111|Tyranitar War]]'' to be her uncle, {{tc|Fisherman}} [[Wilton]].

A Doduo appears with its Trainer at the Mini-game Corner in the {{chap|X & Y}}.

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
{{PPM|Blue}} has two Doduo which he used as a method of {{m|Fly|flight transportation}} to lift up him and his {{p|Blastoise}} in ''[[PM016|Getting The Flying Machine!!]]''.

A Doduo is seen with {{PPM|Green}} during the baseball match that took place in ''[[PM021|Fierce Competition at the Pokémon Baseball Tournament!]]''.

{{PPM|Giovanni}} has a Doduo as seen in ''[[PM077|Pokémon Hair Salon Opens!!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Zensho manga===
{{Zensho|Shigeru}} has a Doduo which he caught it in the Safari Zone.

==Trivia==
[[File:Doduo Fly Stad.png|thumb|"Flying" Doduo]]
* In the {{pkmn|Red and Green beta|Pokémon Red and Blue beta}}, Doduo was originally known as "Dodo", its Japanese name.
* Before [[Generation IV]], the necks of normal Doduo were black (which became the male neck color), while its {{p|Dodrio|evolution's}} necks were beige (which became the female neck color).
* According to its Pokédex entries, Doduo can run at 60&nbsp;mph (100&nbsp;km/h), while {{p|Dodrio}} can only run at nearly 40&nbsp;mph (60&nbsp;km/h). However, Dodrio's base {{stat|Speed}} stat is higher.
* Despite its non-existent wings, Doduo and its evolution are capable of learning {{m|Steel Wing}} and {{m|Fly}}.

===Origin===
Despite its name, it seems like it has more in common with {{wp|ostrich}}es than {{wp|dodo}}s. It also seems to show some similarity to the {{wp|moa}}, an extinct flightless bird indigenous to {{pmin|New Zealand}}, and the {{wp|emu}}, another flightless bird. It also resembles the {{wp|kiwi}} in some ways as well.

====Name origin====
Doduo is a combination of ''{{wp|dodo}}'' (an extinct, flightless bird) and ''duo'' (a pair).

Dodo is literally ''dodo''.
